There are also times where I open an email and get out of said email and it won‚Äôt mark it as unread unless I get in and out of the email several times. Likewise, if I draft an email on either the app or my laptop, it will not sync the draft to other devices. I wish I didn‚Äôt have to use this mailing app for school because it doesn‚Äôt do the things it should be able to do.

title: Needs one thing
text:
Everything through outlook mobile is pretty fluent except when adding in someone to an email with an attachment. For example, if I receive an order from a customer, I usually replay all to the customers buying center to thank them. I will cc in my processing department for direct communication. To ensure the attachment is shared in the reply, I have to save it to my phone, then reattach it. The only alternative is to send 2 emails. One as a reply to the customer, the other as a forward to my processing center; because the attachment is auto included in forward email. 

I suggest when replying to an email with an attachment that there be a pop up question. ‚ÄúReply with attachment‚Äù ‚Äúor without‚Äù.

title: Attach Contact?!?!?!?
text:
I love this app in almost every way. But the one thing I cannot figure out is how to attached a contact to an email. I know if I go find the ‚Äúcontacts‚Äù app in IOS I can share contact and choose outlook to send the vCard through. But what I want to do is be able to do that all in the outlook app. I also want to be able to respond to an email from a colleague asking for someone‚Äôs contact info by doing the following. Clicking reply or reply all then clicking attach file or a new button attach contact. Then I could search my contacts and add one or several contacts to my response. 

If you can add this feature I would greatly appreciated it and use frequently!!!

Thanks!

title: Outlook on iPAD
text: The only trouble I have with Outlook on my iPAD is very often when I am composing a message or replying to a message, I am unable to navigate from the Body to the To: or Cc:. Or from the To: to the Body. I just cannot get it to respond when I try to tap into a different section. I have found a workaround‚Ä¶I close it to ‚ÄúDraft‚Äù, go into the ‚ÄúDrafts‚Äù folder, and reopen it. The first section as mentioned I tap into then works, but I still can‚Äôt move to another section. So for instance, if I reopen it from Drafts and tap into the Body, I can edit there, but if I want to add a recipient to the Cc:, I can‚Äôt tap into that section. I need to close it to Draft again, pop it open again, and tap into the Cc: section.

title: Removed Feature & Compounded Error - No Work Around Available
text:
Outlook was my favorite email app until Microsoft removed the ability to use one OneNote for your entire app. Microsoft compounded the poor design and user experience error by only allowing Microsoft accounts to add in extensions. Any other email accounts such as Gmail, IMAP, etc are unable to access the additional extensions, such as OneNote. I took the time to contact support and voice my concerns to no avail and there is no work around. As a long time Microsoft customer I am definitely disappointed in Microsoft‚Äôs poor design and consideration for the user experience.

Updated UI; makes it hard to difficult to indent with bullet points. Why the send button (which looks like tab in) is on the same control panel, makes no sense. 

This app has gone from one of my favorites, to one I am always looking for ways to replace it.

title: Straight Garbage
text:
This is a terrible email app compared the the built in iPhone mail app. The sad part is, there are no better options in the App Store. I have to have a separate email app for work and personal so I‚Äôm stuck with this dumpster fire. I constantly have to re-login. That‚Äôs the first annoyance. The second is it splits my inbox up into ‚Äúfocused‚Äù and ‚Äúother‚Äù. Why would anyone want their inbox split up? I want to see all of my emails in my inbox in one list. Third annoyance, if an email thread gets too long it won‚Äôt show any of it. So, I have a long conversation with a customer, suddenly I can‚Äôt see what they say. I can totally do business that way. :rolls eyes:

Last annoyance is that suddenly it is decided to stop loading emails after yesterday. It looks like I‚Äôm going to have to integrate my work email into my iPhone mail app and have all of my personal and work emails together.

title: So very close
text:
This app is phenomenal. On both iPad and iPhone. My one complaint, which I dearly hope is addressed in a future release, is to allow for folders to be displayed (collapsed, expanded etc) the same way as they are in desktop. I am a religious user of folders to manage all the different email categories and thread for both my work as well as academics, and sometimes the inability to collapse these folders makes it very difficult to sort through to find an email thread from even the same day. It also discourages me from writing rules to send to folders, because I wouldn‚Äôt be able to clearly see this on mobile!

Looking forward to there hopefully being a change for this in the future. Keep up the great work Dev team :)

title: This app is mandatory, but it‚Äôs also good
text:
Nobody likes email, but that‚Äôs not outlook‚Äôs fault. Nobody likes meetings either, but again, not the app‚Äôs fault. You didn‚Äôt pick to use outlook, it‚Äôs required from work, but again, not the app‚Äôs fault. Honestly all of those things would be good excuses to make the app awful.

But they didn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs smooth, it‚Äôs fast, it loads your email, it loads your calendar. It has notifications you can customize. Swipe commands are fast and the UX is fluid and responsive. It lets me finish my email / scheduling work as quickly as possible and lets me get back to almost literally anything else. And I appreciate that. Thanks outlook team.

title: Productive and Accurate
text:
I really appreciate this app! I get notifications from it immediately (unlike the default mail app on iPhones which mostly only updates periodically), and I think the design of it is really professional and clean looking which I also appreciate. Microsoft in general is just so cool haha and I almost always really like their software designs. It‚Äôs also good for school and work since it has a Groups feature to keep everyone updated with emails/events who needs to be involved. 

I would recommend basically anyone to use this app! Thank you to the developers and everyone involved in producing and maintaining this app!!

title: Company just switched to a Outlook 365 moblle
text: Company decided to switch to outlook 365 in the fourth quarter. Not a very good time in the business year to do that! We were using BlackBerry work prior to this installation and I wish that outlook 365 had some of the same luxe and features. It would be nice to have contact Tile on the toolbar so it would be easier to search for embedded contact information. Using the search function to find contacts seems redundant. Email threads don‚Äôt give me the ability to see the most recent reply first. Unfortunately you have to go to the bottom of the thread to see what you wrote most recently that seems counterintuitive. It would be nice to give users the option to short either in ascending or descending order for Email threads.

title: Add Teams vs Skype in the calendar invite
text: This app has been a great addition to multitasking and scheduling meeting interviews and reminders throughout the pandemic. One thing I would say to add is a space for Microsoft Teams versus the Skype for business. Last I heard after checking  Skype‚Äôs website that they would be phasing out fairly soon. I didn‚Äôt realize this until after scheduling a meeting one day that this was a mistake that was there and it led everyone I had scheduled a meeting for two Skype for business which doesn‚Äôt really exist in our world it‚Äôs either Microsoft teams or zoom if you could update this as quickly as possible it would be a great great addition for us all. Again great app!

title: Almost weekly updates, and it still doesn‚Äôt work right...
text:
I get email notifications, but when I open up Outlook, nothing.  The emails are there, Outlook just won‚Äôt show them.  I have to go to my computer to get them and respond, as some of them are time-sensitive.  Those emails will eventually show up in my inbox, but that can take anywhere from 8 to 72 hours, which is just silly.  I‚Äôve also gone a few days straight where the app reports a ‚Äòlow bandwidth mode‚Äô but after numerous tests, and no issues with any other app, it has to be Outlook being dumb.
On a secondary note, i think I‚Äôve decided to go back to Apple‚Äôs crappy email app due to Microsoft‚Äôs insane amount of data mining within this app, and the integration of the Calendar and to-do‚Äôs just make things a tad simpler.  Seriously people, look at how much information Microsoft is bleeding from this app!

title: S/MIME and Attachments Not Supported
text:
Setup was easy, and the app receives emails, but gives errors forwarding or replying to emails that have digital signatures S/MIME.  Forwarding and replying should not be a problem in a Microsoft Outlook client for mail hosted in Office365, but it is a problem and fails if the message had a signature.  You have to remove the attachment (emails with S/MIME digital signatures treat the signatures as attachments, and replying or forwarding will fail unless you remove the attachment).  Another huge problem is that this app too often it will not even show attachments let alone open them (have to use webmail OWA to properly view attachments, and may need the Okta app to do that), and the app doesn‚Äôt support S/MIME for signing and optionally encrypting new emails.  Failing with basic functionality, and missing S/MIME security options is why I rate this so low.
Note: the desktop version of Outlook on Windows 10 will do what this mobile client fails to do.
